chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc.
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce D. Bestul was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with T.A.B. dob 10/12/1998 or her Mother T.K.
Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18.
Defendant cannot work or volunteer in positions that require him to work with persons under the age of 16.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall complete a sex offender assessment and follow treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration requirements.
